definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Fold the thoughts and wiping open touch in canthus under that bit of tears.
sentences.chinese: 收起思绪，拭开沾在眼角下的那点泪花。

sentences.english: There are tears of joy in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她眼里含着喜悦的泪花。

sentences.english: Therefore your light glistens in my tears.
sentences.chinese: 因此，你的光辉闪烁在我的泪花之中。

sentences.english: With a whirl of skirts and with the brilliant sparkle still in her eyes, she Ran out of the door.
sentences.chinese: 眼睛里还噙着晶莹的泪花，裙子一摆，她奔出房门。

sentences.english: Tears of disappointment and reproach glistened in her blue eyes, but she said nothing.
sentences.chinese: 她蓝色的服里闪烁起失望和责难的泪花，没有说话。

sentences.english: Shining tears in the eyes, reflected in your room dark brown eyes.
sentences.chinese: 闪烁着泪花的眼，倒映在你黑褐色的双眸间。

sentences.english: But I was young and foolish and now I'm full of tears .
sentences.chinese: 但我幼稚而木纳，现在我满眼泪花。

sentences.english: Nor silver - shedding tears could penetrate her uncompassionate sire.
sentences.chinese: 银光闪闪的泪花也不能打动她冷酷无情的父亲。

sentences.english: Tony replies with a glint in his eye, 'I feel just like a newborn baby. '
sentences.chinese: 托尼眼睛闪着泪花回道，“我就像刚出生的婴儿。”

sentences.english: She straightens up, looking tenderly at his dead face through her tears.
sentences.chinese: 她调直，体贴看他死的面孔通过她泪花。

sentences.english: A hundred times before you can squeeze out a salty tear.
sentences.chinese: 一百次，在您能紧压一滴咸泪花之前。

sentences.english: Blue tears in the lilac face, thawing in the rain.
sentences.chinese: 忧郁的泪花在丁香的脸上滑落，融入了雨中。

sentences.english: I began to cry almost at once.
sentences.chinese: 我立即开始哭泣，哭得满脸泪花。

sentences.english: As she started reading the list of the little annoyances, she noticed that tears were starting to appear in her husband's eyes.
sentences.chinese: 当她开始念的时候，她发觉丈夫的眼里噙着泪花。

definition: to hold in (usually refers the mouth or eyes)
to choke with emotion/to choke with sobs
